        Returns:

      • ValidateXMLNode

        public java.lang.String ValidateXMLNode(TextNode node)
        Validates a node with the structure defined.

        Generates all the possible simplified abstract syntax trees of the sentence using the formal language defined in the TEI structure file. When a syntactically well-formed structure is found an empty string is returned. If no well-formed structure is detected, an error of the most complete structure is returned. When two abstract syntax trees are equivalent, only one is stored, avoiding infinite loops.

        Specified by:
        ValidateXMLNode in interface FileManager
        Parameters:
        node - XML node to validate
        Returns:
        String with the error or "" if all correct.

      • checkGroup

        private java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> checkGroup(java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> values,
                                              Particle particle,
                                              TextNode node)
        Checks a SubStructure of only nodes developing the possible abstract trees and removing the incompatible ones.
        Parameters:
        values - Values defining the abstract tree
        particle - SubStructure of only nodes to check the different values
        node - XML node to validate
        Returns:
        HashSet of possible positions having parsed this element

      • hashSetContainsSecond

        private boolean hashSetContainsSecond(java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> set1,
                            java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> set2)
        Checks if set2 is contained in set1.

        Used to go through loops avoiding infinite ones

        Parameters:
        set1 - Set that must have all values of set2
        set2 - Set that must be contained in set1
        Returns:
        True if set2 is contained in set1

      • ElementCheck

        private java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> ElementCheck(TextNode node,
                                                java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> positions,
                                                Reference ref)
        Check a single label in multiple abstract syntax trees and develops all the possible trees this label allows.

        If the formal language of the node allows repetition of this single label, all the possible trees are returned.

        Parameters:
        node - Label node of the textStruct to compare
        positions - Possible positions at which the label can start
        ref - Label to use as reference
        Returns:
        HashSet of possible positions having parsed this element

      • ElementCheckUnity

        private java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> ElementCheckUnity(TextNode node,
                                                     int position,
                                                     Reference ref)
        Check a single label in a single abstract syntax tree and develops all the possible trees this label allows.

        If the formal language of the node allows repetition of this single label, all the possible trees are returned.

        Parameters:
        node - Label node of the textStruct to compare
        position - Position of the label in which we are
        ref - Label to use as reference
        Returns:
        HashSet of possible positions having parsed this element

      • IsTextInNode

        private boolean IsTextInNode(TextNode node)
        Check if we have free text in a node.

        Checks all the possible text places (at the beginning ad end and between labels

        Parameters:
        node - Node to make the check
        Returns:
        Returns true if there is text and false if not.
